name: Nike Air Zoom Pegasus 41
description: Breathable engineered mesh, React X foam and dual Zoom Air pods create an everyday road runner that balances snap and cushion for high-mileage training.

name: Adidas Ultraboost Light
description: Primeknit+ upper hugs the midfoot while a lighter Boost midsole returns energy for neutral runners chasing plush comfort on city loops.

name: Hoka Mach 6
description: A stripped-down supercritical foam platform keeps turnover quick, and an EVA crash pad smooths transitions for uptempo runs.

name: New Balance Fresh Foam X 1080 v13
description: Full-length Fresh Foam X, rocker geometry, and a stretchy Hypoknit upper deliver a premium cushioned cruiser.

name: ASICS Gel-Kayano 31
description: 4D Guidance System stabilizes pronation while PureGEL and FF Blast+ ECO foams keep the ride soft for overpronators.

name: Brooks Ghost 16
description: DNA Loft v3 cushioning with a segmented crash pad caters to neutral runners wanting reliable comfort for daily miles.

name: Saucony Endorphin Speed 4
description: A winged nylon plate sandwiched in PWRRUN PB foam provides snappy turnover for workouts and race day versatility.

name: Nike Alphafly 3
description: Dual Zoom Air units, a full-length ZoomX carrier, and a Flyknit AtomKnit 3.0 upper deliver marathon-day efficiency.

name: Adidas Adizero Takumi Sen 10
description: Lightstrike Pro stacks with EnergyRods 2.0 to power 5Kâ€“10K efforts in a stripped-down racing package.

name: On Cloudmonster Hyper
description: A PEBA-based Speedboard and dual-density Helion HF pods create max bounce for long efforts with a rocker roll.

name: Salomon Speedcross 6
description: Deep Chevron lugs with Contagrip TA rubber bite into slick trails while EnergyCell+ midsole foam softens landings.

name: Hoka Tecton X 2
description: Parallel carbon plates pair with Vibram Megagrip Litebase for a propulsive yet grippy ultra-distance trail racer.

name: Nike Metcon 9
description: A sturdy Hyperlift plate, wide heel, and breathable mesh upper keep lifters stable through HIIT and functional training.

name: Reebok Nano X4
description: Flexweave woven textile with a Floatride Energy Foam midsole supports cross-training sessions from plyos to barbell work.

name: Under Armour TriBase Reign 6
description: TriBase outsole and Micro G cushioning keep feet planted during explosive lifts and agility drills.

name: Nike LeBron XXI
description: Mono-mesh upper, Zoom Turbo forefoot, and Cushlon 2.0 foam deliver plush support for powerful forwards.

name: Adidas Harden Vol. 8
description: Hybrid Lightstrike cushioning and a wide forefoot platform cater to guards seeking smooth step-backs and lateral control.

name: Nike Mercurial Superfly 10 Elite FG
description: Flyknit 360 upper with Vaporposite+ locks the foot while a tri-star stud layout offers rapid acceleration on firm pitches.

name: Adidas Predator Elite FT
description: Hybrid touch upper, Strikeskin fins, and Aerocage support enable precise control for playmakers on natural grass.

name: ASICS Gel-Resolution 9
description: Dynawall stability and AHAR Plus rubber keep tennis players locked in during aggressive baseline cuts.
